page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Much of the land cover in our area is arable farmland. Several different crops are grown. Peas, sugar beet, wheat, barley, onions, sprouts and strawberries are the main crops. In a few fields sugar beet is grown with a border of barley or potatoes. This is to make the harvesting of beet easier. Most of the wheat and barley is cut in late August and early September. The beet is harvested in October. Potatoes are taken up in autumn by hand and machine. The crops are changed from year to year to keep the land good. There are a few meadows which provide pasture for cattle. Drainage ditches run alongside most of the fields. The herds are Friesian, Jersey and Hereford. Some bullocks are slaughtered in early November. Poultry is bred by factory farming methods for major suppliers.
